dmca.title: Unauthorized Use of Alley Baggett Properties
dmca.body:
From: Dennis L. Wilson [mailto:dwilson@kmwlaw.com] 
Sent: Monday, January 23, 2006 5:22 PM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Subject: Unauthorized Use of Alley Baggett Properties



Dennis L. Wilson, Esq.

KEATS McFARLAND & WILSON LLP

9720 Wilshire Blvd., Penthouse Suite

Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Tel: (310) 248-3830

Fax: (310) 860-0363

 

January 23, 2006

 

VIA ELECTRONIC MAIL

U.S. MAIL AND FAX

 

ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

Attn: George Poletes / Legal

1333 Stemmons Fwy., Ste. 110

Dallas, TX 75207

 

legal-response@theplanet.com

Fax: (214) 782-7756

 

Re:       Unauthorized Use of Alley Baggett Properties

http://www.99modelle.com

 

To Whom It May Concern:

 

This letter is being written to you on behalf of Alley Baggett.  Ms. Baggett
is the owner of all copyright and other intellectual property rights in and
to the photographs and images of herself.  No one is authorized to copy,
reproduce, distribute, or otherwise use Ms. Baggett's photographs or images
without the express written permission of Ms. Baggett.

 

It has come to Ms. Baggett's attention that the website located at
http://www.99modelle.com/default_categoria.php?IDCATEGORIA=119, for which
you are the service provider, is reproducing, distributing, and/or
displaying unauthorized copies of  photographs and/or images of Ms. Baggett.
Attached hereto are photocopies of representative pages from the
aforementioned website.  

 

Ms. Baggett has the good faith belief that the use of the material in the
manner complained of is not authorized by Ms. Baggett, her agent, or the
law.  Ms. Baggett diligently enforces her rights relative to her photographs
and images in all forms of media.  Our client rightfully takes her
responsibility for the protection of her intellectual property rights very
seriously.

 

As you may be aware, Internet Service Providers can be held liable if they
do not respond to claims of infringement pursuant to the requirements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act ("DMCA") and/or international laws with
similar effect.  In accordance with the DMCA, we request your assistance in
removing the material infringing upon Ms. Baggett's intellectual property
rights from this website and any other websites for which you act as an
Internet Service Provider.  We further declare under penalty of perjury that
we are authorized to act on behalf of Ms. Baggett and that the information
in this letter is accurate.  Please contact me immediately to discuss this
matter further.

 

This letter is not a complete statement of Ms. Baggett's rights in
connection with this matter, and nothing contained herein constitutes an
express or implied waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses of Ms.
Baggett in connection with this matter, all of which are expressly reserved.

 

Very truly yours,

 

/s/

 

Dennis L. Wilson

Keats McFarland & Wilson LLP

 

DLW:ccd

Enclosures (via U.S. mail and FAX)

cc:        Alley Baggett
dmca.principal_name: KEATS McFARLAND & WILSON LLP (for Ms. Baggett)
